title: SAP: Synch sales orders to Azure Blob Storage using OData
description: This workflow template triggers on a recurring schedule and supports processing downstream SAP transactional data in Azure. The workflow uses the publicly available SAP [S/4HANA public cloud sandbox](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2282241), and produces CSV. When you use this template, use the URL and authentication scheme for your own SAP system. For more information, see [Get started with SAP and Microsoft integration scenarios](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2282033).
prerequisites: To access a private SAP system on Azure, use [virtual network integration](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2282334). For an on-premises SAP system, change the SAP connector's OData setup to use the [on-premises data gateway](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2282414).

parameters.name: loopLimit_#workflowname#
parameters.description: The maximum number of loops to use when requesting data from SAP through OData.

parameters.name: odata-api-key_#workflowname#
parameters.default: The SAP API Business Hub key for the OData API.
parameters.description: Get your API key from the [SAP API Business Hub](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2282241).

parameters.name: azure-container-name_#workflowname#
parameters.description: The name of the Azure Storage account container to store the data extracted from SAP.

parameters.name: azure-blob-name_#workflowname#
parameters.description: The name of the blob in an Azure storage account container to store the data extracted from SAP in CSV format.
